snippet: Mr. Duncan rose from working as a ditch digger to employ his booming bass voice and immense physical presence in many movie roles, most notably a tragic prisoner with a healing touch in the 1999 film “The Green Mile.”
abstract: Michael Clarke Duncan, actor who rose from working as a ditch digger to employ his booming bass voice and immense physical presence in many movie roles, dies at age 54.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Duncan rose from working as a ditch digger to employ his booming bass voice and immense physical presence in many movie roles, most notably a tragic prisoner with a healing touch in the 1999 film “The Green Mile.”

headline.seo: Michael Clarke Duncan, Actor, Dies at 54
